alert.note: Alert for Inland Northern Brevard; Orange; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Orange and northeastern Osceola Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lone Cabbage Fish Camp, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wedgefield, Lone Cabbage Fish Camp, Bithlo and Christmas. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
